articles.author: Mike Bird
articles.title: Europe Markets Steady Amid Political, Trade Tensions
articles.description: European stocks were little changed in morning trading, following a selloff in Asia driven by Italy’s unfolding political drama and heightened global trade tensions.

articles.title: Evan Spiegel said it was 'frustrating' Snap hired scantily clad women dressed as deer for a party
articles.description: Snap CEO Evan Spiegel said it was a 'wake-up call' when a female former employee sent an internal letter slamming the company's bro-like culture. On Tuesday, Spiegel also confirmed that his company had hired scantily clad women dressed as deer to serve appeti…

articles.title: Market pain; Italy turmoil; Trade war fears
articles.description: Here's what you need to know about the markets before you start your business day.

articles.author: Oscar Williams-Grut
articles.title: Ad guru Sir Martin Sorrell is back, just 6 weeks after quitting WPP
articles.description: Sir Martin Sorrell has formed a new investment vehicle, S4 Capital, which is coming to the stock market through a reverse merger. It comes just six weeks after Sorrell was forced out of WPP amid an investigation into allegations of improper behavior and misus…

articles.author: Jon Russell
articles.title: Amazon begins nationwide expansion of Whole Foods discounts for Prime members
articles.description: Amazon introduced 10 percent savings at Whole Foods for Prime members earlier this month, and today it kicked off a nationwide expansion of the initiative. The Prime Whole Foods discount — one of a number of measures following Amazon’s acquisition of Whole Fo…

articles.title: China slams surprise US trade announcement, says ready to fight
articles.description: SHANGHAI/BEIJING (Reuters) - China on Wednesday lashed out at Washington's unexpected statement that it will press ahead with tariffs and restrictions on investments by Chinese companies, saying Beijing was ready to fight back if Washington was looking to ign…

articles.author: Leslie Josephs
articles.title: Flyers are actually more satisfied with (most) airlines in the US. Here's how carriers stack up
articles.description: Air travelers are happier with U.S. airlines this year compared with last year, a J.D. Power survey showed.

articles.author: David Fickling
articles.title: Diamonds Aren't Forever
articles.description: Who wants to seal an engagement with something whose price makes it feel little better than costume jewelry?

articles.author: https://www.nytimes.com/by/zach-wichter
articles.title: 18 Hours and 45 Minutes: Longest Commercial Flight Returns to Service
articles.description: Singapore Airlines hopes more efficient planes can make the route more economically viable than the last time it flew it, in 2013.

articles.author: David McLaughlin, Lydia Mulvany, Naomi Kresge
articles.title: Bayer Wins US Approval for Monsanto After Two-Year Quest
articles.description: Bayer AG won U.S. antitrust approval for its $66 billion takeover of Monsanto Co., clearing the last major regulatory hurdle to forming the world’s biggest seed and agricultural-chemicals provider after a nearly two-year global review.

articles.author: Valerie Richardson
articles.title: Starbucks opens door to homeless, drug problems with anti-discrimination recipe
articles.description: With its decision to allow the non-paying public unlimited access to its cafes, Starbucks may have traded one grande problem for another.

articles.author: Michael Sheetz
articles.title: Richard Branson says Virgin Galactic is '2 or 3' flights away from taking people to space
articles.description: Virgin Galactic's latest accomplishment leaves founder Richard Branson excited for the coming months of spaceflight.

articles.author: Brittny Mejia
articles.title: Tesla in Autopilot mode crashes into parked Laguna Beach police cruiser
articles.description: A Tesla sedan in "autopilot" mode struck a parked Laguna Beach Police Department vehicle on Tuesday morning, authorities said.

articles.author: http://www.nytimes.com/by/rachel-abrams, https://www.nytimes.com/by/tiffany-hsu, http://www.nytimes.com/by/john-eligon
articles.title: Starbucks's Tall Order: Tackle Systemic Racism in 4 Hours
articles.description: The coffee chain closed its U.S. stores for several hours to improve its image after the arrests of two black men at a store in Philadelphia brought heavy criticism.

articles.description: Wages at one California Chick-fil-A will soon surpass a lot of salaries, including educators, healthcare professionals and more.

articles.author: Robert McMillan
articles.title: Canadian Hacker Gets Five-Year Sentence Following 2014 Yahoo Breach
articles.description: Canadian Karim Baratov was sentenced to five years in prison over charges stemming from the massive 2014 security breach at Yahoo, a campaign federal authorities have alleged was orchestrated by Russian spies.

articles.author: Jordan Novet
articles.title: Microsoft is now more valuable than Alphabet — by about $10 billion
articles.description: Google first surpassed Microsoft in market cap in 2012 but the two have flip-flopped several times since.

articles.author: Austen Hufford
articles.title: Allergan Recalls Taytulla Birth-Control Packs After Pills Placed Out of Order
articles.description: Allergan is recalling nearly 170,000 sample packs of its birth-control treatment Taytulla after placebo and active capsules were placed out of order, potentially raising the risk of an unintended pregnancy.

articles.author: Austen Hufford
articles.title: MGM Resorts to Buy New York Casino for About $605 Million
articles.description: MGM will acquire the Empire City Casino in Yonkers from the Rooney family, which has owned the operation for more than four decades.
